Recommendations: Adjuvant radiation to the surgical bed, ipsilateral neck and contralateral level 2, combined with weekly chemotherapy as a radiosensitizer
Patient_History_Status_Former_Status_of_: Diabetes mellitus type 2, high blood pressure, hypercholesterolemia, benign prostate hyperplasia
Clinical_Assessments_Radiological_Lesion: Aggressive process involving the right entire hemimaxilla extending to the alveolar ridge, hard palate, and maxillary sinus wall, transgressing the floor of the orbit and extending into the right inferior periorbital tissue, involving the pterygopalatine fossa
Others: Suspicious focal hypermetabolism seen in the prostate, lymphovascular invasion is seen, one lymph node removed ipsilaterally during the preparation for the flap was positive for malignancy with a deposit of 1.2 cm, but no extracapsular extension
